sub_topic: The Feigenbaum constant and universality in chaotic systems
message_1: What is the Feigenbaum constant α to four decimal places for the logistic map described by the function f(x) = 4x(1 - x)?
message_2: The Feigenbaum constant α, also known as the Feigenbaum bifurcation constant, is a universal constant that appears in the study of chaotic systems, specifically in the period-doubling route to chaos. For the logistic map described by the function f(x) = 4x(1 - x), the Feigenbaum constant α is approximately 2.5029 to four decimal places.
